conclusion: Understand the behavior of light in a triangular glass prism.
Identify properties of the triangular glass prism: equilateral, angles equal, light rays perpendicular to hypotenuse.
Understand behavior of light entering prism: initially travels straight, deviates as angle increases.
Light b initially travels straight, deviates as angle increases, reaches critical angle for total internal reflection.
Total internal reflection occurs when angle of incidence equals angle of refraction.
Light b first undergoes total internal reflection when angle of incidence exceeds critical angle.
Critical angle for light b is greater than for light a, so light b undergoes total internal reflection first.
Conclude light b undergoes total internal reflection first when angle of incidence is greater than critical angle for light a.
